column2: OH DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column6: OH

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column6: Roundabout ahead. Slow down.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 2. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column6: One Way

column2: 4. Yellow traffic signs:
column6: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 5. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column6: Service signs

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: Four-lane highway ahead

column2: 7. This sign means:
column6: lane ends, merge left.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column6: Side road

column2: 9. The yield sign means:
column6: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column10: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 10. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column6: green; white

column2: 11. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column6: Danger ahead.
column8: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column6: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 13. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
column6: is a divided highway.

column2: 14. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column6: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 15. This sign indicates:
column6: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column10: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 17. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 18. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: there's an intersection ahead.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column6: Lane shifting

column2: 20. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.

column2: 21. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 22. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column6: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 23. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
column6: orange

column2: 24. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column6: Arrows

column2: 25. When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
column4: stop regardless of your direction of travel.
column6: stop if you are driving in the same direction.
column8: slow down and pass the bus with caution.

column2: 26. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column10: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.

column2: 27. Braking distance is:
column4: how far a vehicle will continue to travel before the driver hits the brakes.
column6: how far a vehicle will travel, in ideal conditions, while the driver is braking.
column10: the total distance a vehicle has traveled until it comes to a complete stop.

column2: 28. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column4: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.
column6: during daylight hours only.

column2: 29. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column6: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 30. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Take a cold shower before driving.
column6: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column8: Stop drinking one hour before driving.

column2: 31. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: require more space for turning movements.
column6: take longer than cars to stop.
column8: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column10: are easier for the driver to operate.

column2: 32. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column10: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 33. Your BAC depends on:
column6: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 34. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
column6: sound your horn.

column2: 35. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column6: green, red and yellow.

column2: 36. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 37. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column6: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column8: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column10: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.

column2: 38. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column6: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column8: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.

column2: 39. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column6: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column10: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.

column2: 40. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column6: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column8: try pumping it to increase pressure.
column10: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
